I would also like to have the digests on the release page. I tried to ask for something similar in #256 but so far there has been no response. I seems pretty fundamental to me to be able to address specific versions. It would had also helped me in #347 as well. So \+10 from me. 

‌

content.raw: There is a [README](#!/osrf/subt/src/default/docker/) in the `docker` director on the repository that contains instructions for building docker images locally from the repository.  If you need immediate triage, I would recommend reverting to the `default` branch dated on the previous docker release and rebuild the image for yourself locally.
content.html: There is a README in the docker director on the repository that contains instructions for building docker images locally from the repository. If you need immediate triage, I would recommend reverting to the default branch dated on the previous docker release and rebuild the image for yourself locally.

content.raw:
Thanks Arthur, I will make sure I can build these images correctly locally. 

I like to use the official images for testing though, which is why a version or published hash would be useful. Thanks to Zbyněk I was able to get my simulation environment working again with the 03/29 images.
content.html:
Thanks Arthur, I will make sure I can build these images correctly locally.

I like to use the official images for testing though, which is why a version or published hash would be useful. Thanks to Zbyněk I was able to get my simulation environment working again with the 03/29 images.
